title: What the Health? From KFF Health News: The Hazards of ICE for Public Health
summary: The Trump administration’s immigration crackdown is not just roiling politics but also directly affecting the provision of health care, medical groups say. Meanwhile, in Washington, federal spending bills have been stalled by the fight over immigration enforcement funding after the shooting death of a second person in Minneapolis this month. Maya Goldman of Axios, Alice Miranda Ollstein of Politico, and Rachel Roubein of The Washington Post join KFF Health News’ Julie Rovner to discuss those stories and more.

title: This Teen Never Got His Day in Vaccine Court. His Former Lawyer Now Advises RFK on Its Overhaul.
summary: The federal government’s Vaccine Injury Compensation Program was supposed to help patients with their medical bills while protecting vaccine supply. But allies of Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. are routinely transferring cases from that program to launch lawsuits against drugmakers.

title: Medicare Advantage Insurers Face New Curbs on Overcharges in Trump Plan That Reins in Payments
summary: Proposed Trump administration changes to federal Medicare Advantage payments would stop health insurers from mining patient data for extra medical diagnoses that generate more bills to taxpayers even without treatment.

title: When Suicidal Calls Come In, Who Answers? Georgia Crisis Line Response Rates Reveal Gaps
summary: In Georgia, a high number of callers to the 988 crisis line hang up or disconnect before reaching a counselor. Many other calls are transferred out of state.

title: Listen to the Latest ‘KFF Health News Minute’
summary: The "KFF Health News Minute” brings original health care and health policy reporting from our newsroom to the airwaves each week.

title: Trump Policies at Odds With Emerging Understanding of Covid’s Long-Term Harm
summary: Studies increasingly offer insights into the health risks and burdens faced by people who have had covid infections. Meanwhile, the Trump administration has narrowed covid vaccine recommendations and cut research.

title: Doctors Increasingly See AI Scribes in a Positive Light. But Hiccups Persist.
summary: Patients say they find AI summaries of doctor visits user-friendly, but it’s not clear if their appointments are improving. In any case, doctors appear to be embracing the high-tech innovation.

title: Watch: A Strange Checkup Bill Revealed a Firefighter’s Kids Were Mistakenly Uninsured
summary: This installment of InvestigateTV and KFF Health News’ “Costly Care” series explores how administrative errors can leave patients on the hook for bills they shouldn’t owe — sometimes with few options to correct a problem they didn’t create.

title: Políticas del gobierno chocan con el conocimiento emergente sobre los daños a largo plazo de covid
summary: Estos hallazgos generan nuevas preocupaciones sobre las políticas relacionadas con covid durante la administración Trump, según investigadores.

title: Cada vez más médicos ven con buenos ojos a los asistentes de IA. Pero aún hay tropiezos
summary: Los médicos están considerando a estos asistentes de IA ambiental como una herramienta revolucionaria que les permite concentrarse en sus pacientes en lugar de en el teclado.
